intro: Verbesina tostimontis, commonly known as the Mexican ironweed, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its tall, erect stems and showy yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky soils. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are arranged in dense, terminal clusters. Verbesina tostimontis is known for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional herbal remedies.
